page.title: 05FARMING - CROPS
page.content: Park Farm is a mixed arable farm and the crops are wheat and barley, sugar beet and maize for maize sillage to feed the bull beef reared. The proportions are two thirds corn to about one third beet. We enjoyed a ride in a landrover to look at the crops. The average field size is 45 acres and yielded 3.5 tons per acre last year, a record. We saw a field of winter wheat which had been in the ground for 11 months, fertilized three times, sprayed five times and intended for turkey feed. The maize we saw would be chopped up, blown into an air-tight silo (14 years old) and fed to cattle. The sugar beet should be lifted aboyt the 3rd week in September.
